description:
{"data": {"production":{"id":"kicks","production_title":"Kicks","production_status":2,"production_desc":"

In director Justin Tipping's feature debut Kicks, nothing is as simple as it seems. 15-year-old Brandon longs for a pair of the freshest sneakers that money can buy; assuming that merely having them on his feet will help him escape the reality of being poor, neglected by the opposite sex and picked on by everyone -- even his best friends.

Working hard to get them, he soon finds that the titular shoes have instead made him a target after they are promptly snatched by local hood, Flaco. Seemingly the embodiment of menace, Flaco harbors complexities of his own that will be revealed when Brandon goes on a mission to retrieve his stolen sneakers with his two best friends in tow.

Boasting a strong ensemble cast, and featuring a memorable lead performance by newcomer Jahking Guillory, the film transcends a deceptively traditional hero's journey to deliver an entertaining and sobering look at the realities of inner-city life, the concept of manhood and the fetishization of sneaker culture. Visually and thematically rich, with an amazing soundtrack of both hip-hop classics and Bay Area favorites, Kicks creates an authentic and original portrait of a young man drowning in the expectations of machismo.

Watch the Official Trailer for KICKS.

","description":"

A first look at director Justin Tipping's directorial debut KICKS.

","is_featured":1,"is_trailer":1,"external_url":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wWV2hK4HVEk","columns":3,"max_width":0,"thumb":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/_tmp/1468860274_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_2-1194x495.jpg","related_items":[],"tags":" c43 c44 c","loop_vid":0,"img":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/1468860274_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_2.jpg","video":"https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wWV2hK4HVEk"},{"id":"jahkingguillory_bio","aid":147,"content_type":"bio","title":"Jahking Guillory as Brandon","short_desc":"

An undeniable young talent on the rise, actor and rapper Jahking Guillory (Brandon) is already a veteran in the entertainment business at the age of 14.

Born and raised in Long Beach California, ‘King’ started pursuing his dream at 9 years old landing jobs in national commercials, music videos and national print campaigns.

","description":"

Graduating to larger roles in film and TV, King has already shown how versatile an actor he is, playing the ultra-cool kid with swagger, to the computer geek, to the teenage drug dealer. In addition to acting, King is a talented rapper and works on his craft every day. He writes lyrics about his life and makes beats with his friends to every song he records.

Jahking is also a championship athlete. He played running back for superstar rapper Snoop Dogg’s Junior football team, winning five championships. He is also a track champion -- winning the 800 and 1500 meter dash in the Junior Olympics.

","is_featured":0,"is_trailer":0,"external_url":"http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5795819/?ref_=tt_cl_t1","columns":3,"max_width":1250,"thumb":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/_tmp/1468875468_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_cast1b-1194x499.jpg","related_items":[{"id":"guillory-insta-quote","url":"/image/guillory-insta-quote","title":"Guillory Insta Quote","thumb":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/_tmp/1468870497_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_1social-148x148.jpg"},{"id":"officialtrailer","url":"/video/officialtrailer","title":"KICKS Official Trailer","thumb":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/_tmp/1468860274_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_2-148x61.jpg"}],"tags":" c47 c48 c","loop_vid":0,"img":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/1468875468_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_cast1b.jpg","video":""},{"id":"social_insta_brandon","aid":243,"content_type":"social","title":"Don't Let Nobody Get Inside Your Head","short_desc":"

","description":"","is_featured":0,"is_trailer":0,"external_url":"https://www.instagram.com/p/BJleEPvAwTY/?taken-by=kicksfilm","columns":1,"max_width":600,"thumb":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/_tmp/1472786605_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_christophermeyer_social3-398x398.jpg","related_items":[{"id":"flacco-insta","url":"/social/flacco-insta","title":"Flacco Insta","thumb":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/_tmp/1468870376_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_2social-148x148.jpg"},{"id":"la-times-piece","url":"/social/la-times-piece","title":"LA Times Piece","thumb":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/_tmp/1468871199_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_news1-148x83.jpg"},{"id":"social_insta_unclemarlon","url":"/social/social_insta_unclemarlon","title":"Uncle Marlon Tells It How It Is","thumb":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/_tmp/1472786071_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_christophermeyer_social1-148x148.jpg"}],"tags":" c48 c46 c","loop_vid":0,"img":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/1472786605_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_christophermeyer_social3.jpg","video":""},{"id":"christophermeyer_bio","aid":149,"content_type":"bio","title":"Christopher Meyer as Rico","short_desc":"

Talented and captivating, nineteen year old Christopher Meyer (Rico) can next be seen be seen as one of the stars of second season of Fox’s hit mid-season series Wayward Pines. A psychological thriller that focuses on a Secret Service agent who goes to Wayward Pines, Idaho, in search of two federal agents who have gone missing in the bucolic town and soon learn that they may never get out alive.

","description":"

Christopher plays ‘Mario,’ a 20-year-old bulked up and self-important captain of the militaries quadrant in command of Jason Higgins who runs the whole city of Wayward Pines and one of Kerry Campbell's soldiers. Mario is a man who follows orders and a tough guy who doesn't ask questions -- and doesn't answer them either. Starring as the lead of the second season is veteran actor Jason Patric as ‘Dr. Theo Yedlin” and returning from last season is Terrence Howard, Oscar® winner Melissa Leo and Carla Gugino and new to the cast this season is actor Djimon Hounsou. The show’s second season premieres Wednesday, May 25, 2016. Christopher can also be seen starring in two upcoming films premiering at the TRIBECA Film Festival!

Opening competition for Tribeca Film Festival is Director Justin Tipping’s Kicks that leads off the newly created U.S. Narrative competitive slate, written by Joshua Beirne-Golden and Justin Tipping.

Also premiering at Tribeca is Meyer’s other project Wolves. In the film, Meyer has a strong supporting role playing ‘Hakim’ a.k.a. Hakim the dream, the captain of the basketball team who embodies the voice and spirit of the team. The powerful drama directed and written by Bart Freundlich centers on the star of NYC high school’s basketball team, Anthony Keller (Taylor John Smith), who is riding his way to Cornell on a sports scholarship. Anthony can only maintain his popular jock façade for so long before his father Lee’s (Michael Shannon) gambling addiction threatens to derail his dreams both on and off the court. Meyer’s character ‘Hakim’ provides some levity to the film, which also stars Carla Gugino and Chris Bauer.

In addition to his show on Fox and two Tribeca films, Christopher can also be seen recurring on the hit CBS crime drama, NCIS: New Orleans where he plays ‘Danny Malloy,’ a foster kid that, after his parents are murdered, is taken under the wing of CCH Pounder so that he can stay and protect his younger brother.

Born in Brooklyn, New York and raised in West Palm Beach, Florida, Christopher was 10 years old when he got the acting bug. Shortly after graduating from Bak Middle School of the Arts, he landed his first paid acting gig on General Hospital and felt like he was on top of the world.

When Chris isn’t busy charming audiences on the big and small screens, he enjoys playing basketball, going to the movies, hanging with friends, and rapping.

","description":"","is_featured":0,"is_trailer":0,"external_url":"","columns":1,"max_width":600,"thumb":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/_tmp/1468870376_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_2social-398x398.jpg","related_items":[{"id":"officialtrailer","url":"/video/officialtrailer","title":"KICKS Official Trailer","thumb":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/_tmp/1468860274_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_2-148x61.jpg"}],"tags":" c46 c","loop_vid":0,"img":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/1468870376_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_2social.jpg","video":""},{"id":"142","aid":142,"content_type":"quote","title":"Variety Quote","short_desc":"","description":"

This is a debut of undeniable promise.

","is_featured":0,"is_trailer":0,"external_url":"http://variety.com/2016/film/reviews/kicks-review-tribeca-1201757909/","columns":1,"max_width":0,"thumb":"","related_items":[],"tags":" c45 c","quote_author":"ANDREW BARKER","quote_source":"VARIETY","rating":"","loop_vid":0,"img":"","video":""},{"id":"justintipping_bio","aid":153,"content_type":"bio","title":"Justin Tipping, Director/Co-Writer","short_desc":"

JUSTIN TIPPING (Director, co-writer) Justin Tipping is a writer/director who was born and raised in the Oakland, CA bay area.

In addition to Kicks, Justin is in postproduction on Lowriders for Universal Pictures, Blumhouse Productions, and Imagine Entertainment, starring Demian Bichir, Eva Longoria, and Melissa Benoist.

","description":"

He has written films for Sony, TriStar Pictures, Double E Pictures, Trigger Street Productions, and The Weinstein Company.

His short film, NANI, won more than a dozen awards internationally, including the Student Academy Award and the Director’s Guild of America Student Award after its world premiere in competition at the Berlin International Film Festival.

As a director, Justin was selected by the Weinstein Company and Lexus to direct a short film as part of a global Lexus campaign as well as by Sony to direct a short film as part of the Sony 4k series. He holds a BA in Film and Media Studies from the University of California, Santa Barbara and an MFA in Directing from the American Film Institute Conservatory.

","is_featured":0,"is_trailer":0,"external_url":"http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3258390/","columns":1,"max_width":600,"thumb":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/_tmp/1469662543_kicks_justintipping_bio-398x597.jpg","related_items":[{"id":"officialtrailer","url":"/video/officialtrailer","title":"KICKS Official Trailer","thumb":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/_tmp/1468860274_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_2-148x61.jpg"}],"tags":" c47 c53 c","loop_vid":0,"img":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/1469662543_kicks_justintipping_bio.jpg","video":""},{"id":"social_insta_unclemarlon","aid":241,"content_type":"social","title":"Uncle Marlon Tells It How It Is","short_desc":"

The LA Times Asks "Can movies like KICKS usher in the next wave of Spike Lees?"

Given how the influence directors Spike Lee and John Singleton have had on millennial filmmakers -- and given the extent to which new diversity-minded stories are aching to be told -- it was only a matter of time before a whole new class of young black stories emerged.

Read the full article here.

","description":"","is_featured":0,"is_trailer":0,"external_url":"http://www.latimes.com/entertainment/movies/moviesnow/la-et-mn-tribeca-film-festival-kicks-justin-tipping-spike-lee-20160415-story.html","columns":1,"max_width":680,"thumb":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/_tmp/1468871199_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_news1-398x224.jpg","related_items":[{"id":"guillory-insta-quote","url":"/image/guillory-insta-quote","title":"Guillory Insta Quote","thumb":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/_tmp/1468870497_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_1social-148x148.jpg"},{"id":"officialtrailer","url":"/video/officialtrailer","title":"KICKS Official Trailer","thumb":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/_tmp/1468860274_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_2-148x61.jpg"}],"tags":" c45 c","loop_vid":0,"img":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/1468871199_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_news1.jpg","video":""},{"id":"mahershalaali_bio","aid":152,"content_type":"bio","title":"Mahershala Ali as Marlon","short_desc":"

Mahershala Ali (Marlon) is fast becoming one of the freshest and most in-demand faces in Hollywood with his extraordinarily diverse skill set and wide-ranging background in film, television, and theater.

This past fall, Ali wrapped the independent feature film, Moonlight, as well as reprised his role in The Hunger Games: Mockingjay - Part 2, the fourth and final installment in the critically and commercially acclaimed Hunger Games. Ali will next star in Gary Ross’s civil war era drama The Free State of Jones opposite Matthew McConaughey, Gugu Mbatha-Raw, and Keri Russell.

","description":"

On television, Ali was recently cast in Netflix and Marvel Entertainment’s Luke Cage in the role of Cornell “Cottonmouth” Stokes. Ali stars alongside Mike Colter, Rosario Dawson, and Alfre Woodard.

Ali can currently be seen on the award-winning Netflix original series House of Cards, where he will reprise his fan-favorite role as lobbyist and former press secretary Remy Danton for a fourth season in February 2016.

Ali’s previous feature film credits include The Place Beyond the Pines, Crossing Over, Go For Sisters, and The Curious Case of Benjamin Button.

On television, he appeared in Lifetime’s The Wronged Man for which he subsequently received a NAACP Nomination for Best Actor.  Ali also had a large recurring role on Syfy’s Alphas, as well as the role of Richard Tyler, a Korean War pilot, on the critically acclaimed drama The 4400 for three seasons.

On the stage, Ali appeared in productions of Blues for an Alabama Sky, The School for Scandal, A Lie of the Mind, A Doll’s House, Monkey in the Middle, The Merchant of Venice, The New Place and Secret Injury, Secret Revenge. His additional stage credits include appearing in Washington, D.C. at the Arena Stage in the title role of The Great White Hope, and in The Long Walk and Jack and Jill.

Born in Oakland, California and raised in Hayward, Ali received his Bachelor of Arts degree in Mass Communications at St. Mary’s College. He made his professional debut performing with the California Shakespeare Festival in Orinda, California. Soon after, he earned his Master’s degree in acting from New York University’s prestigious graduate program.

","is_featured":0,"is_trailer":0,"external_url":"http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0991810/?ref_=tt_cl_t5","columns":2,"max_width":915,"thumb":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/_tmp/1468873482_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_mahershalaali_cast5-796x332.jpg","related_items":[],"tags":" c47 c51 c","loop_vid":0,"img":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/1468873482_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_mahershalaali_cast5.jpg","video":""},{"id":"kofisiriboe_bio","aid":151,"content_type":"bio","title":"Kofi Siriboe as Flacco","short_desc":"

Kofi Siriboe (Flacco) is already making waves in the entertainment industry and is becoming one of the premiere sought after young actors in Hollywood. Born and raised in Los Angeles California, he is first generation West African and the great grandson of a highly respected Ghanaian King of the Juaben / Ashanti tribe. The life-changing encounter with an agent at a mall in Beverly Hills launched Siriboe's career at the tender age of 6yrs old.

","description":"

Kofi has already amassed quite a resume, quickly building a reputation as a "director's actor". His unique ability landed him his silver screen debut portrayal of "Javy Hall" in Ice Cube's The Longshots. Since then, he has added other films such as; Academy Award winning film Whiplash and a lead role in the coming of age story Kicks, slated to premiere at the 2016 Tribeca Film Festival.

On the small screen, Siriboe has lent his talent to hit television shows like CSI: Lincoln Heights and MTV's teen comedy hit Awkward. Currently, Kofi is a series regular in critically acclaimed director Ava Duvernay's television drama Queen Sugar, co-executive produced by Oprah Winfrey. When he is not pursuing his passion of acting, he is collaborating with other creatives in the arts, writing songs or modeling for Wilhelmina NY. A budding philanthropist, he is committed to working with children through multiple charitable causes across the globe. 

","is_featured":0,"is_trailer":0,"external_url":"http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2492243/?ref_=tt_cl_t4","columns":1,"max_width":359,"thumb":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/_tmp/1468873208_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_kofisiriboe_cast4-398x418.jpg","related_items":[],"tags":" c47 c52 c","loop_vid":0,"img":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/1468873208_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_kofisiriboe_cast4.jpg","video":""},{"id":"social_insta_originals","aid":244,"content_type":"social","title":"Originals Never Go Out Of Style","short_desc":"

MIKE COVINO (Producer) is a producer and writer from New York City. Along with Kicks he recently produced the feature films Hunter Gatherer and Keep In Touch.

","description":"

He is Co-Founder of Unbundled Underground, a NY & LA based production company with a focus on producing feature films and commercials.

He graduated from Occidental College where he played football and dunked a basketball, once.

","description":"","is_featured":0,"is_trailer":0,"external_url":"","columns":1,"max_width":600,"thumb":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/_tmp/1468870429_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_3social-398x398.jpg","related_items":[{"id":"officialtrailer","url":"/video/officialtrailer","title":"KICKS Official Trailer","thumb":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/_tmp/1468860274_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_2-148x61.jpg"}],"tags":" c46 c","loop_vid":0,"img":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/1468870429_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_3social.jpg","video":""},{"id":"joshuabeirnegolden_bio","aid":154,"content_type":"bio","title":"Joshua Beirne-Golden, Co-Writer","short_desc":"

JOSHUA BEIRNE-GOLDEN (co-writer) is a writer and producer who was born in San Francisco, California and grew up on the east coast.

In addition to his work on Kicks, he is currently in post-production on Lowriders for Universal Pictures, Blumhouse Productions, and Imagine Entertainment, starring Demian Bichir, Eva Longoria, Melissa Benoist, and Tony Revolori.

","description":"

He has written films for Sony, TriStar Pictures, Double E Pictures, Trigger Street Productions, and The Weinstein Company.

His short film, NANI, world premiered in competition at the Berlin International Film Festival and went on to win more than a dozen awards at festivals worldwide, including a Student Academy Award. He holds a BFA in Dramatic Writing from NYU's Tisch School of the Arts and an MFA from the American Film Institute Conservatory.

","is_featured":0,"is_trailer":0,"external_url":"http://www.imdb.com/name/nm4454043/","columns":1,"max_width":823,"thumb":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/_tmp/1468970754_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_crew2-398x202.jpg","related_items":[{"id":"officialtrailer","url":"/video/officialtrailer","title":"KICKS Official Trailer","thumb":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/_tmp/1468860274_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_2-148x61.jpg"}],"tags":" c47 c57 c","loop_vid":0,"img":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/1468970754_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_crew2.jpg","video":""},{"id":"143","aid":143,"content_type":"quote","title":"Film Journal Quote","short_desc":"","description":"

Shocking, Raw, Remarkable.

","is_featured":0,"is_trailer":0,"external_url":"http://www.filmjournal.com/features/look-back-tribecas-bounty-docs-and-features","columns":1,"max_width":0,"thumb":"","related_items":[],"tags":" c45 c","quote_author":"DORIS TOUMARKINE","quote_source":"FILM JOURNAL","rating":"","loop_vid":0,"img":"","video":""},{"id":"davidkaplan_bio","aid":155,"content_type":"bio","title":"David Kaplan, Producer","short_desc":"

DAVID KAPLAN (Producer) is one of the co-founders of New York City based production company Animal Kingdom, Kaplan's credits include Destin Daniel Cretton's Short Term 12 (executive producer, SXSW 2013), Joe Swanberg's Drinking Buddies (executive producer, SXSW 2013), Gillian Robespierre's Obvious Child (executive producer, Sundance 2014), David Robert Mitchell's It Follows (producer, Cannes 2014).

","description":"

Kaplan's upcoming films include Adam Leon's second feature Tramps (currently in post-production), Eliza Hittman's second feature Beach Rats (currently in pre-production) and Trey Edward Shults' second feature It Comes at Night (currently in development with A24).

Kaplan has previously served as a single picture finance executive at Cinetic Media and as the director of development at Killer Films. He was named one of Variety's "10 Producers to Watch" in 2014 and one of Screen International's "Future Leaders" in 2015.

","is_featured":0,"is_trailer":0,"external_url":"http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3346661/","columns":1,"max_width":823,"thumb":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/_tmp/1468971125_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_crew3-398x202.jpg","related_items":[{"id":"officialtrailer","url":"/video/officialtrailer","title":"KICKS Official Trailer","thumb":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/_tmp/1468860274_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_2-148x61.jpg"}],"tags":" c47 c54 c","loop_vid":0,"img":"http://focusmicrosites.s3.amazonaws.com/assets/uploads/1468971125_kicks_justintipping_jahkingguillory_crew3.jpg","video":""},{"id":"adeleromanski_bio","aid":156,"content_type":"bio","title":"Adele Romanski, Producer","short_desc":"

ADELE ROMANSKI (Producer) is an independent producer who, over the past decade, has produced an eclectic body of films with an emphasis on supporting first time directors, beginning with David Robert Mitchell’s The Myth of the American Sleepover - which premiered at SXSW and won a Special Jury Prize before going on to an international premiere at Cannes as part of the Critic's Week sidebar.

","description":"

Recent projects include Chad Hartigan’s Germany/USA co-production Morris From America, which premiered in competition at Sundance 2016 winning the Waldo Salt Screenwriting Award and earning Craig Robinson a Jury Award for Acting; And also Barry Jenkins’ long-anticipated sophomore film, Moonlight, produced in partnership with Brad Pitt’s Plan B and A24, currently in post-production and to be released by A24.

Other credits include Katie Aselton’s The Freebie and Black Rock and Jacob Vaughan’s horror-comedy Bad Milo!.

Adele is a 2010 Sundance Creative Producing Fellow and a 2012 IFP/Rotterdam Lab Producing Fellow. She earned an Independent Spirit Award nomination (Piaget Producing Award) for The Myth of the American Sleepover. Adele has since served on the Advisory Board of IFP and was also a mentee in the inaugural class of the Women 18 Filmmaker’s Initiative consisting of a select group of Sundance women directors and producers.

She was recently awarded the 2016 Amazon Studios Sundance Institute Producers award, alongside producing partner Sara Murphy. Adele first attended Sundance in 2007 as a volunteer where out of a staff of more than 1,800 she was one of eight volunteers awarded ‘best of the fest’ for ‘exceptional service and consistently going “above and beyond” her volunteer job description’.
